title: S-object
summary: In algebraic topology, an S {\displaystyle \mathbb {S} } -object (also called a symmetric sequence) is a sequence { X ( n ) } {\displaystyle \{X(n)\}} of objects such that each X ( n ) {\displaystyle X(n)} comes with an action[note 1] of the symmetric group S n {\displaystyle \mathbb {S} _{n}} .
